item.title: Why Flight of the Bumblebee is a great etude
item.description: I play the clarinet as a hobby although I used to play it competitively during high school. Unfortunately, since I began my undergraduate studies, I have stopped receiving lessons, which are quite expensive. So during undergrad, my playing ability rarely improved. However, perhaps thanks to COVID-19, I have had more spare time recently and have been able to find practice routines that have worked for me to become a better player.

item.title: Favorite clarinet clips
item.description: Here are some of my favorite clarinet clips. I have watched them countless times. Tchaikovsky’s Nutcracker for the clarinet and orchestra Sergey’s playing is so lyrical. He sings with the clarinet. I can listen to his playing all day. Rossini’s Introduction, Theme and Variations Valentin’s articulation is god-level. His conducting is also god-level. Everything about this so god. His cadenza in the end is legendary! Spohr #2 concerto The soloist effortlessly plays this notoriously difficult piece.

item.title: About
item.description: During high school, I was diagnosed with a nerve injury within my right hand from playing the clarinet, leaving me with no choice but to become ambidextrous. I had to longitudinally retrain my brain so that my left hand could properly write alphabets and hold chopsticks, the responsibilities that had been formerly assigned to my right hand. The experiences from my recovery sparked my interest in neural plasticity. For my undergraduate education, I pursued Anatomy and Cell Biology at McGill University and graduated within the top 10% of my class on June 2017.

item.title: Breathe by Lee hi
item.description: Breathe is one of my favorite songs. Many covers have been recorded. Here are my favorites. Original by Lee hi This is the original recording of the song. Han Dong Geun Han’s control of dynamic is amazing. His arrangement strays from the original but is absolutely beautiful. Kyu Hyun His voice is beautiful. Very clear and resonant. This rendition is very faithful to the original
